intro: Erica venustiflora subsp. venustiflora, commonly known as the sweet heather, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It prefers full sun to partial shade and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers. Erica venustiflora subsp. venustiflora is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
